comment.author: 55198937@N05
comment._content: This looks like Day Street between King and Market Streets, with the new Pyrmont Bridge (opened 1902) crossing in the background.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/angeljim46] Good call!  I think you are right.  It's all obliterated for western distributors nowadays but this c.1927 street map helps - 

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw/6662642331/sizes/o/]

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/angeljim46] Nice work! Just spotted this image in the SLNSW's collection, looks to be the same print. Dated 1906 & titled 'New Section of Day Street'. [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Thanks!
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons
